comment.author: 29809546@N00
comment._content: Was he a teacher? W C Foley of Ferrybank is mentioned as attending the annual congress of the County Waterford National Teachers' Association in June 1897.

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/johnspooner] We don't have any other information about him at all, John. Just Foley and Ferrybank, unfortunately.
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 64555638@N00
comment._content: Some kind of enamel or metal badge on his lapel.

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/eyelightfilms] There is, but infuriatingly, even at the highest res/biggest size, it's not possible to make out what it is!
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 14302637@N08
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/johnspooner] Ferrybank was over the border in Kilkenny. William Canice FOLEY was a National School Teacher living in Abbeylands, Kilculliheen, Kilkenny. 1901 census www.census.nationalarchives.ie/pages/1901/Kilkenny/Kilcul... 1911 census www.census.nationalarchives.ie/pages/1911/Kilkenny/Kilcul...

comment.author: 33577523@N08
comment._content: Ferrybank is on the Kilkenny side of the river but it is part of Waterford. W.C. Foley was the grandfather of Irish Times Journalist and author Donal Foley whose father Dan was also a teacher. www.ferrybankparish.com/stmarys/history.htm

comment.author: 99684904@N00
comment._content: Ah from the days when people still knew how to dress properly.

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/33577523@N08] Any idea as to where/how to get our hands on a photo of the teacher W.C. Foley, so we could confirm whether this is he?
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/blackpoolbeach] Interesting. His first wife must have died between 1901 and 1911 censuses...
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 33577523@N08
comment._content: I haven't come across any photos of W.C. Foley I'm afraid, I was sort of hoping there might be something in the NLI vaults.

comment.author: 14302637@N08
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/nlireland] His children Daniel, Patrick, Julia and William have all left home by 1911. This could be Daniel Foley, 25, married, National Teacher in 1911. www.census.nationalarchives.ie/pages/1911/Waterford/Water...

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/33577523@N08] Only one other photo taken of this chap on the same day (although there could be other pictures not yet catalogued). Going to go mad altogether and just throw this out there. Any possibility that our Mr Foley pictured here in 1905 could be the same as this Mr Foley, pictured on 11 July 1918??
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/blackpoolbeach] Back to arguing about ages again!  :)
Think this Mr Foley is older than 19 or 20 which he'd have to have been here in 1905, if he were Daniel Foley, aged 25 in March 1911...
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 14302637@N08
comment._content:
I meant his son Daniel who was 15 in 1901 and 25 in 1911.
Daniel Junior went on to be the father of Irish Times Journalist and author Donal Foley.

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/blackpoolbeach] Oh my apologies! I'm with you now...
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 33577523@N08
comment._content: Found a photo of Dan Foley on The Waterford County Museum web site, I think this is probably from the early 1930's when he ran for election as a Labour candidate. Dan Foley

comment.author: 33577523@N08
comment._content: I think the gentleman in the above photo is definitely W.C. Foley. On the National Library's online catalogue the caption for this photo is Mr Foley- Ferrybank N.S., N.S. being National School I believe. Mr Foley- Ferrybank N.S. Mr Foley-Ferrybank, sitting.

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/33577523@N08] Well, will we hazard it then, subject to correction if further information comes in? Now added to description. Thanks to you, plus  [http://www.flickr.com/photos/johnspooner] and [http://www.flickr.com/photos/blackpoolbeach].
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 33577523@N08
comment._content: Another descendent of William Foley is writer and broadcaster Catherine Foley who contributes to RTE's Sunday Miscellany programme, she would be his great grand daughter and a niece of Donal.

comment.author: 75116182@N04
comment._content: Wonderful picture! great quality of the photo. Really nice portrait

comment.author: 12099135@N05
comment._content: Nice image.  Love the old portraits!
comment.authorname: NIKONGERL / Please do not copy my images without p

comment.author: 94003650@N03
comment._content: Hi. i'm Philip Foley, a great grandson of William Foley. Looking at the photos above I can see a strong resemblance to my own father and my nephew David Foley. My father is Tom Foley. His father was Dan Foley, Labour candidate. Dan Foley was also the Principal of Ferrybank National School. He died in his forties when my father was aged about 8. I was intrigued to see the names of my fathers uncles and aunts in the census.
